subject: Newbie unit testing question
msgSnippet: I have just started learning Java, so forgive me my newbieness.  I want to ramp up to developing EJB s, and would like to combine unit testing with my build
messageBody:
I have just started learning Java, so forgive me my newbieness. I want
to ramp up to developing EJB's, and would like to combine unit testing
with my build process (Maven).

I have heard that there is a Cactus plug-in for Maven. However, there
are two problems with using Cactus: everyone who has used it for unit
testing says that it's more pleasurable to have bamboo shoved under
his/her fingernails, and the Cactus plug-in for Maven has been broken
for over a year.

I understand that JUnitEE can be used for some unit testing of EJB's,
but what I have read indicates that I may not be able to automate the
testing in Maven.

Any suggestions?
